title: Port C++ tests to Catch
body_html:
This PR addresses #5648. In particular, following the discussion at #5648:

  • it vendors Catch (https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2 v2.2.0) in torch/aten/utils
  • it ports all ATen tests to Catch
  • it ports torch/csrc/jit/test_jit.cpp to Catch (libtorch only, Python build is unaffected)

One note: catch.hpp is a large source file. It has been vendored in ATen (vendoring is the recommended option in the Catch README), but we may want to keep it out of the repository and provide a download step for building tests. Feedback welcome.

Possibilities:

  • vendoring (as current)
  • git submodule
  • CMake file command (https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/command/file.html)
  • CMake ExternalProject_Add command (https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/module/ExternalProject.html)
  • wget in a bash file

Possibilities:

body:
This PR addresses #5648. In particular, following the discussion at #5648:

- it vendors Catch (https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2 v2.2.0) in `torch/aten/utils`
- it ports all ATen tests to Catch
- it ports `torch/csrc/jit/test_jit.cpp` to Catch (libtorch only, Python build is unaffected)

One note: catch.hpp is a large source file. It has been vendored in ATen (vendoring is the recommended option in the Catch README), but we may want to keep it out of the repository and provide a download step for building tests. Feedback welcome.

Possibilities:
- vendoring (as current)
- git submodule
- CMake `file` command (https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/command/file.html)
- CMake `ExternalProject_Add` command (https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/module/ExternalProject.html)
- `wget` in a bash file
